line_2: In a garden live like me,
And homeward walking, wept o'er me
For Love sincere and Friendship free
Ah, Death! what sacrifice to thee
But, Stranger, 'tis no tale for thee,
Beneath yon flowery turf they lie,
So lightly lie the turf on thee,
And made each charm of polish'd courts agree
From ostentation as from weakness free,
It stands like the caerulean arch we see,
To wander here, and smiling see
"Her beauties with unwearied eyes we see;
The oddest Compound you can see
Well in thy Seat, my friend, I see,
